name: Kwesi Adu Cobbina
title: PhD Candidate in Computer Science
researchSummary: I am a PhD candidate in Computer Science at the University of Maryland, advised by Prof. Tianyi Zhou and Prof. Tom Goldstein. My research sits at the intersection of natural language processing, multimodal learning, and optimization. I study how large language models encode and leverage in-context information — from positional biases in demonstration placement to efficient reasoning trace compression — with the goal of making LLMs more robust, efficient, and equitable.
